document.docTitle: Psychomyia complexa Li, Morse & Peng 2020, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Psychomyia (Trichoptera: Psychomyiidae) from China, with re-descriptions of two species

heading.emphasis:
Psychomyia complexa Li, Morse & Peng
, n. sp.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Male genitalia of
Psychomyia complexa Li, Morse & Peng
,
n. sp.
and supplementary information: 1a , left lateral; 1b , right half of tergum IX, right preanal appendage, and right apical sclerite, mesal (left preanal appendage omitted); 1c , dorsal; 1d , ventral; 1e , collection label, paratype label and identification label of the paratypes deposited at Clemson Universiy; 1f , one paratype, male, dorsal; 1g , same, left lateral ( 1e–1g , photographed by J.C. Morse). Abbreviations: a. s. = apical sclerite (paired); cox. = coxopodite (paired); end. = endotheca; har. = harpago (paired); pha. = phallotheca; pre. app. = preanal appendages (paired); t. IX = tergite IX. Scale bar refers to 1a–1d.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: The new species belongs to Schmid’s (1997)
P . flavida
Species Group, somewhat resembling
Psychomyia selatana Oláh & Johanson 2010
from Indonesia in the ventral view of the harpagones. However, the new species can be easily distinguished from the other members of the group, especial from
P. selatana
by the following features: (1) the apical sclerites of segment IX each have a finger-like basal process ventromesally; (2) the harpagones are plate-like, with their bases rounded and apices trifurcate; and (3) the base of the complex of apical sclerites of segment IX has a large pair of dorsomesal setal warts.

( NJAU ).

Etymology: The Latin feminine noun in apposition
complexa
refers to the harpagones which are of complex shape in ventral view.

Remarks: This new species was first recognized and described by Dr. Youwen Li under supervision of Dr. John C. Morse ( Li 1998 ) as
Psychomyiella complexa
( Figs 1 e– 1g ), but has remained unpublished in the meaning of the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature (International Commission for Zoological Nomenclature 1999 ). However, the holotype and some paratypes designated by Li & Morse are now kept in NJAU, therefore we have had the opportunity to examine these types. The species was redescribed and re-illustrated as
Psychomyia complexa
by Dr. Shuang Qiu (2018) in her doctoral dissertation based on the same type materials. In our study, we also identified this species from specimens collected from Zhe-jiang Province in 2017. For all of the reasons above, we publish this new species with Drs Li & Morse as authors in recognition of their contributions to the genus. Dr. Qiu also agreed that we publish it (personal communication). Types designated by Drs Li & Morse have been used unchanged.
